name: re2
description: Alternative to backtracking PCRE-style regular expression engines

repo.name: re2
repo.description: RE2 is a fast, safe, thread-friendly alternative to backtracking regular expression engines like those used in PCRE, Perl, and Python. It is a C++ library.

readme.summary: Excellent documentation with clear explanations, strong examples, and comprehensive API coverage, but lacks troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section—common errors, build failures, or runtime issues are not documented

security.summary: The code appears to be generally secure, but some potential issues with input validation and error handling were identified that should be addressed to ensure the security of the application.

common_complaints: Build/installation issues (missing headers, git install failures)
Thread safety and performance concerns with shared RE2 objects
sentiment.summary: RE2 shows moderate community health with active technical issues being raised but mixed maintenance responsiveness; legitimate bug reports coexist with spam/off-topic issues, suggesting the project needs better issue triage.

red_flags: some responses seem brief or unhelpful
communication.summary: The maintainer provides generally helpful and clear responses, but could improve in terms of patience and consistency in handling repeated or basic questions.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-22)
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of issue triage
No merged PRs in past 6 months suggesting no active development or contributions
No active contributors in past 6 months
7 open issues with no resolution activity
positive_signals: Recent commit activity shows some engagement (2026-01-22)
No open pull requests preventing stalled reviews
maintenance.summary: The re2 package shows signs of stagnation with no meaningful activity (commits, merged PRs, or closed issues) in the past 6 months despite a recent commit, indicating a project in maintenance limbo with potential abandonment.

governance.summary: The governance documentation for the homebrew package 're2' lacks clear plans for succession, decision making, contributor advancement, and multiple maintainers, posing a high bus factor risk.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to the RE2 library, its features, and usage examples, but lacks clear troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting section
Communication: some responses seem brief or unhelpful
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
highlights: Recent commits and releases within the last day
High number of commits, closed issues, and merged PRs in the past 6 months
